result.execSummary:
The defendant Brentt G Kuruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Defendant Brentt G Kuruz in court with attorney James H. Krave.  Defendant Brentt G Kuruz in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 3.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts 5, 7 and 9 are Dismissed and Read In.  Bond revoked.  Court orders PSI.  Attorney Krave provides copy of discovery to the defendant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brentt G Kuruz in court with attorney James H. Krave.  Defendant Brentt G Kuruz in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF82 and 15CF83: Defendants are currently unrepresented. Court continues bond and adjourns hearing pending representation. Date to be set once attorneys are appointed. 

15CF80 & 15CF81: Continue with preliminary hearing. 8:13: Detective Jason Hagen with the Barron County Sheriff's Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies Defendant Kuruz and Defendant Roux. 8:30: Cross by Attorney Krave. 8:32: Cross by Attorney Babbitt. Court finds probable cause on both cases and binds over for trial. State files Informations.
